Simmered Rabbit Meat with Scallion & Ginger

Prismatic Braised Egg
li.Desc: Boil the ingredient in water, refill the pot until it is hard boiled, and then cut it to slices. Sprinkle ground powder of Prismatic Fruit on and stir-fry it in a special method. This dish is sweet, savory but not greasy. (Thank you beta tester: 人境庐 for providing this recipe.)

li.Name: Dragon Breath Egg
li.Desc: Simmer the ingredient in extremely hot burned sycamore ash for 14/h without any seasoning, bringing out the ultimate flavor of the egg. With the combined smell of herbs and explosive fire element, this dish has a lingering aftertaste that suits your palate. (Thank you beta tester: 人境庐 for providing this recipe.)

li.Name: Prismatic Braised Egg
li.Desc: Boil the ingredient in water, refill the pot until it is hard boiled, and then cut it to slices. Sprinkle ground powder of Prismatic Fruit on and stir-fry it in a special method. This dish is sweet, savory but not greasy. (Thank you beta tester: 人境庐 for providing this recipe.)

li.Name: Dragon Breath Egg
li.Desc: Simmer the ingredient in extremely hot burned sycamore ash for 14/h without any seasoning, bringing out the ultimate flavor of the egg. With the combined smell of herbs and explosive fire element, this dish has a lingering aftertaste that suits your palate. (Thank you beta tester: 人境庐 for providing this recipe.)

li.Name: Prismatic Braised Egg
li.Desc: Boil the ingredient in water, refill the pot until it is hard boiled, and then cut it to slices. Sprinkle ground powder of Prismatic Fruit on and stir-fry it in a special method. This dish is sweet, savory but not greasy. (Thank you beta tester: 人境庐 for providing this recipe.)

li.Name: Dragon Breath Egg
li.Desc: Simmer the ingredient in extremely hot burned sycamore ash for 14/h without any seasoning, bringing out the ultimate flavor of the egg. With the combined smell of herbs and explosive fire element, this dish has a lingering aftertaste that suits your palate. (Thank you beta tester: 人境庐 for providing this recipe.)

li.Name: Wind of the Wild
li.Desc: Use a difficult technique to roast a boar's hams with heavy fire, resulting in three drastically different flavors and tastes: the outside is crispy and spicy, the middle layer is crunchy and chewy, and the inside is tender and juicy. Eating this dish is like stepping into the wild; It has a nomadic characteristic to it.

li.Name: 24 Bridges Bathed in the Bright Moonlight
li.Desc: Cut the boar's tenderloin into thin slices, marinate them with seasoning, stuff them into 24 balls made from tofu, and then slowly cook them in broth; One of a kind delicacies.

li.Name: Willow in the Wind
li.Desc: Cut beef into thin slices, use a difficult technique to stir-fry them and then place the dish carefully onto plate. It is mildly seasoned, but still has a delicious aftertaste. The meat has the perfect flavor to it, but it can be easily overcooked as they are all thin slices.

li.Name: Beef Tongue Delicacy
li.Desc: Beef tongue is an extremely tender meat that has a naturally sweet flavor, and this dish even brings out its best quality by using few spices to protect the original taste and flavor of the ingredient.

li.Name: Crystal Rabbit
li.Desc: Cook rabbit meat with a special method, making it translucent as crystal. It tastes tender and has a special fragrance, a dish that is not only good-looking but also delicious.

li.Name: Rabbit Meat with Five Spices
li.Desc: Stir-fry diced rabbit meat with five different spices, and the five flavors complements each other, making the flavor more layered. What's important is controlling the temperature and time. The spices will blend into each other and lose the layers of flavor if unbalanced.

li.Name: Sun Devouring Wolf
li.Desc: Wolf meat stew cooked with bean sauce and dozens of ingredients. The rich content will be slowly revealed as you drink the soup bit by bit, and the ingredients all have their own special flavor.

li.Name: Burning Flame
li.Desc: Repeatedly stir-fry the best meat on the wolf's back with hot pepper. Even in the dead of winter, it will still bring the utmost heat for the whole body after eating this spicy and irresistible dish.

li.Name: Dragon Soup
li.Desc: Taking the imagery of carp leaping over the dragon's gate, this soup is mostly depended on the intricate order of cooking and use of spice, making it taste far better than normal fish dishes.

li.Name: Fish Hidden in Lamb
li.Desc: Stuff fish inside a large, sliced-open lamb, and cook it with condiments, creating a delicate taste. The flavor of fish combined with that of lamb makes it even more delicious. The lamb is soft and juicy, with tender and delicate fish stuffed inside.

li.Name: Prosperity of Dragon & Phoenix
li.Desc: Marinate snake meat mixed with chicken, slowly cook them inside a stock pot until the soup thickens. The flavors of two kinds of meat complements each other, creating the perfect taste.

li.Name: Turtle & Snake
li.Desc: Place turtle and snake meat together to simmer in a stock pot. Both kinds of meat are chewy and tasty, making it a fine dish for supplementing nutrients.

li.Name: Hair of Worries
li.Desc: Noodles thin as hair, coupled with four special kinds of gravy, tasty and so tender that it melts in your mouth; it is the ultimate noodle.

li.Name: Soup Dumplings of Morality
li.Desc: A dish passed down from the royal families. Divide the inside of the dumpling into five chambers, and then stuff five special fillings representing five kinds of moralities—benevolence, righteousness, manners, wisdom, and trustworthiness. Steam it over low heat, five flavors will be separate; steam it over high heat, the wrapper inside the dumpling will break under the heat, and soup fillings will mix up, creating unpredictable and interesting flavors.

li.Name: Tear and Share Bun
li.Desc: A special kind of bun originated from a southern, coastal city, soft, fluffy and sweet; It melts tastily in your mouth and has a wonderful flavor. The bun holds all the memories of that city.

li.Name: Hair of Worries
li.Desc: Noodles thin as hair, coupled with four special kinds of gravy, tasty and so tender that it melts in your mouth; it is the ultimate noodle.

li.Name: Soup Dumplings of Morality
li.Desc: A dish passed down from the royal families. Divide the inside of the dumpling into five chambers, and then stuff five special fillings representing five kinds of moralities—benevolence, righteousness, manners, wisdom, and trustworthiness. Steam it over low heat, five flavors will be separate; steam it over high heat, the wrapper inside the dumpling will break under the heat, and soup fillings will mix up, creating unpredictable and interesting flavors.

li.Name: Smooth-cream Drizzles
li.Desc: Place well-shaped mushrooms erect on a piece of white tofu, and keep dripping a special soup onto it while steaming. There are still drops of soup on the mushroom cap, thus the name of the dish.

li.Name: Steamed Lotus Root with Seven Stuffings
li.Desc: It used to be used in sacrificial ceremonies; then, it was introduced to common households and became a famous dish. Take a lotus root with seven holes as the main ingredient, separately stuff special ground meat of seven different livestock inside, steam it and then cut it into slices. The steps are not complicated, but it requires ingredients of the best quality and a skilled cook.

li.Name: Over the Dragon's Gate
li.Desc: Cut both ends of a whole lotus root and hollow out the inside. Place it in a specially-made, two-flavor hot pot; add broth and ice in one side, clear soup and little grunions from the Cloud Lake in the other side over high heat, and then serve it.

li.Name: Crystal Pear
li.Desc: Freeze fine-quality pears in extremely low temperature, peel them to reveal the pear pulp that has become translucent during the process. Carve them into different shapes quickly and then serve the dish; sculpted, translucent pears are partly hidden, partly visible in the mist, bringing a cold but sweet sensation to your palate. It is a dish that is not only good-looking but also delicious.

li.Name: Cicada's Wings
li.Desc: Peel fine-quality pears, cut them into slices thin as cicada's wings, and then stick them slice by slice onto the wall of an ice bowl made of ginger syrup. The pear slices thin as cicada's wings tastes sweet, crisp and delicious; after eating all the slices, the melted ginger syrup will be ready to drink. Although cold, it is still a tasty beverage regardless of the season.

li.Name: Fruit Jungle
li.Desc: Use the most common wild berries as the main ingredient, create various fruit flavors with the most complicated cooking technique and different condiments, and then place it in a large dish. It cannot be copied without a highly-skilled cook who can turn dust into gold.

li.Name: Turtle & Snake
li.Desc: Place turtle and snake meat together to simmer in a stock pot. Both kinds of meat are chewy and tasty, making it a fine dish for supplementing nutrients.
